cards.name: Aerial Modification
cards.text:
Enchant creature or Vehicle
As long as enchanted permanent is a Vehicle, it's a creature in addition to its other types.
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has flying.

cards.flavor: The Consulate recruits its best pilots from the League of Aeronauts. Many go on to command entire fleets.
cards.name: Aeronaut Admiral
cards.text:
Flying
Vehicles you control have flying.

cards.name: Aether Inspector
cards.text:
Vigilance
When Aether Inspector enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Whenever Aether Inspector attacks, you may pay {E}{E}. If you do, create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.

cards.flavor: Gremlins in the wild feed on nodules of pure aether, which are also prized by miners.
cards.name: Aethergeode Miner
cards.text:
Whenever Aethergeode Miner attacks, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Pay {E}{E}: Exile Aethergeode Miner, then return it to the battlefield under its owner's control.

cards.flavor: "Supplies inbound. Keep that pressure on."
cards.name: Airdrop Aeronauts
cards.text:
Flying
Revolt — When Airdrop Aeronauts enters the battlefield, if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn, you gain 5 life.

cards.flavor: "Sure, you know the law. But I know the streets."
cards.name: Alley Evasion
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Target creature you control gets +1/+2 until end of turn.
• Return target creature you control to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: "This little critter can turn all of you to scrap in under thirty seconds! Come on, who wants to be the first to go? Try and stop me!"
cards.name: Audacious Infiltrator
cards.text: Audacious Infiltrator can't be blocked by artifact creatures.

cards.flavor: Headquartered at the Bastion of the Honorable, the Consulate's enforcers are charged with the impossible task of keeping the peace.
cards.name: Bastion Enforcer

cards.flavor: The "leaking spire" stands for liberation from Consulate control.
cards.name: Call for Unity
cards.text:
Revolt — At the beginning of your end step, if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn, put a unity counter on Call for Unity.
Creatures you control get +1/+1 for each unity counter on Call for Unity.

cards.flavor: While hunting aether, a gremlin may ignore other stimuli, including threats to its own life.
cards.name: Caught in the Brights
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
When a Vehicle you control attacks, exile enchanted creature.

cards.flavor:
"The workshops are silent. Our creations have been seized. They have killed what made us alive."
—Pia Nalaar
cards.name: Consulate Crackdown
cards.text: When Consulate Crackdown enters the battlefield, exile all artifacts your opponents control until Consulate Crackdown leaves the battlefield.

cards.flavor: "There is no greater coward than one who believes in nothing."
cards.name: Conviction
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+3.
{W}: Return Conviction to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: "Go forth and cause trouble, my little one!"
cards.name: Countless Gears Renegade
cards.text: Revolt — When Countless Gears Renegade enters the battlefield, if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn, create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.

cards.flavor:
"It came to rest upon the angel's arm, and then the weight of their gazes fell upon me."
—Aeronaut's journal
cards.name: Dawnfeather Eagle
cards.text:
Flying
When Dawnfeather Eagle enters the battlefield, creatures you control get +1/+1 and gain vigilance until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "It seems there's even better hunting down here."
cards.name: Deadeye Harpooner
cards.text: Revolt — When Deadeye Harpooner enters the battlefield, if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn, destroy target tapped creature an opponent controls.

cards.flavor: "A key weakness in the design is its vulnerability to repeated, forceful blows."
cards.name: Decommission
cards.text:
Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
Revolt — If a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn, you gain 3 life.

cards.flavor:
"With spy thopters all around, how can the consuls be so blind to Tezzeret's manipulations?"
—Gideon Jura
cards.name: Deft Dismissal
cards.text: Deft Dismissal deals 3 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three target attacking or blocking creatures.

cards.flavor: A living invention born of a grand design.
cards.name: Exquisite Archangel
cards.text:
Flying
If you would lose the game, instead exile Exquisite Archangel and your life total becomes equal to your starting life total.

cards.flavor: The loyalty of a felidar is hard won but worth the effort.
cards.name: Felidar Guardian
cards.text: When Felidar Guardian enters the battlefield, you may exile another target permanent you control, then return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control.

cards.flavor: Many airship captains keep pets that share their love of the sky.
cards.name: Ghirapur Osprey
cards.text: Flying

cards.flavor: Dwarves' tools are priceless heirlooms handed down through generations.
cards.name: Restoration Specialist
cards.text: {W}, Sacrifice Restoration Specialist: Return up to one target artifact card and up to one target enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: "I can no longer sit in my workshop and ignore the events outside. My hammers strike for the people of Ghirapur."
cards.name: Solemn Recruit
cards.text:
Double strike
Revolt — At the beginning of your end step, if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn, put a +1/+1 counter on Solemn Recruit.

cards.flavor: "As this conflict grows, it gets harder to prevent the city from breaking down. How much longer can we keep this machinery balanced?"
cards.name: Sram, Senior Edificer
cards.text: Whenever you cast an Aura, Equipment, or Vehicle spell, draw a card.

cards.flavor: "It's important to always have the right tool for the job. This one is for picking my teeth."
cards.name: Sram's Expertise
cards.text:
Create three 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature tokens.
You may cast a card with converted mana cost 3 or less from your hand without paying its mana cost.

cards.flavor: The Consulate's eyes—unblinking, unsleeping—are everywhere.
cards.name: Thopter Arrest
cards.text: When Thopter Arrest enters the battlefield, exile target artifact or creature an opponent controls until Thopter Arrest leaves the battlefield.

cards.name: Aether Swooper
cards.text:
Flying
When Aether Swooper enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Whenever Aether Swooper attacks, you may pay {E}{E}. If you do, create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.

cards.flavor:
"To survive up here, I've learned when to use my harpoon and when to just enjoy the view."
—Kadhu, skywhaler
cards.name: Aethertide Whale
cards.text:
Flying
When Aethertide Whale enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E}{E}{E}{E}{E} (six energy counters).
Pay {E}{E}{E}{E}: Return Aethertide Whale to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: "The echo of silence is music to my ears."
cards.name: Baral, Chief of Compliance
cards.text:
Instant and sorcery spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
Whenever a spell or ability you control counters a spell, you may draw a card. If you do, discard a card.

cards.flavor: "Get out of my way."
cards.name: Baral's Expertise
cards.text:
Return up to three target artifacts and/or creatures to their owners' hands.
You may cast a card with converted mana cost 4 or less from your hand without paying its mana cost.

cards.flavor: "This armor transcends the limitations of mere flesh and bone."
cards.name: Bastion Inventor
cards.text:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

cards.flavor:
"How easily your flames are quenched."
—Baral, Chief of Compliance
cards.name: Disallow
cards.text: Counter target spell, activated ability, or triggered ability. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)

cards.flavor: As renegade forces closed in on the Aether Spire, Consulate blockades failed one by one.
cards.name: Dispersal Technician
cards.text: When Dispersal Technician enters the battlefield, you may return target artifact to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: For some of Ghirapur's aerowrights, building thopters is a byproduct of larger construction efforts.
cards.name: Efficient Construction
cards.text: Whenever you cast an artifact spell, create a 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature token with flying.

cards.flavor:
"As a kid, I dreamed of flying on those wild drakes. They inspired me to build wings of my own."
—Nadja Cloudtoucher, aerowright
cards.name: Hinterland Drake
cards.text:
Flying
Hinterland Drake can't block artifact creatures.

cards.flavor:
"Slow the Consulate with whatever you've got!"
—Jasi Ganin, master siphoner
cards.name: Ice Over
cards.text:
Enchant artifact or creature
Enchanted permanent doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

cards.flavor:
"When everything hangs on a single moment, be sure you choose the right moment."
—Jace Beleren
cards.name: Illusionist's Stratagem
cards.text:
Exile up to two target creatures you control, then return those cards to the battlefield under their owner's control.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor: The daredevil racers of the Derby Crows, long at odds with the Consulate, were quick to join the renegades in open revolt.
cards.name: Leave in the Dust
cards.text:
Return target nonland permanent to its owner's hand.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor:
"Give me eight walkers, I'll give you the city."
—Dovin Baan
cards.name: Mechanized Production
cards.text:
Enchant artifact you control
At the beginning of your upkeep, create a token that's a copy of enchanted artifact. Then if you control eight or more artifacts with the same name as one another, you win the game.

cards.flavor:
"Too little, too late. The machine is in motion."
—Tezzeret
cards.name: Metallic Rebuke
cards.text:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}.

cards.flavor:
"It is fascinating to see how the people of this plane replicate magical techniques without a natural gift. Also frustrating."
—Jace Beleren
cards.name: Negate
cards.text: Counter target noncreature spell.

cards.flavor: "Let's just broaden its surveillance lens."
cards.name: Quicksmith Spy
cards.text: When Quicksmith Spy enters the battlefield, target artifact you control gains "{T}: Draw a card" for as long as you control Quicksmith Spy.

cards.flavor: The Hold, an illegal research facility in a derelict merchant ship, became a wellspring of renegade intelligence.
cards.name: Reverse Engineer
cards.text:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
Draw three cards.

cards.flavor: A hermit crab goes through many shells in its lifetime, and not all are natural in origin.
cards.name: Salvage Scuttler
cards.text: Whenever Salvage Scuttler attacks, return an artifact you control to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: Conflict breeds opportunity.
cards.name: Shielded Aether Thief
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Whenever Shielded Aether Thief blocks, you get {E} (an energy counter).
{T}, Pay {E}{E}{E}: Draw a card.

cards.flavor: Shipwrecks do wonders for the local fauna, providing both shelter and aether.
cards.name: Shipwreck Moray
cards.text:
When Shipwreck Moray enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E}{E}{E} (four energy counters).
Pay {E}: Shipwreck Moray gets +2/-2 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Escapes should always be daring.
cards.name: Skyship Plunderer
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Skyship Plunderer deals combat damage to a player, for each kind of counter on target permanent or player, give that permanent or player another counter of that kind.

cards.flavor: "You can tell me what I want to know, or you can talk to the Chief of Compliance. Why don't you make it easy on yourself?"
cards.name: Take into Custody
cards.text: Tap target creature. It doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

cards.flavor: "The tools of the past will help us forge the future."
cards.name: Trophy Mage
cards.text: When Trophy Mage enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an artifact card with converted mana cost 3, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Whir of Invention
cards.text:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
Search your library for an artifact card with converted mana cost X or less, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: Small aeronaut societies like the Wind-Kin had little to lose by siding with the renegades, and much to gain.
cards.name: Wind-Kin Raiders
cards.text:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
Flying

cards.name: Aether Poisoner
cards.text:
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
When Aether Poisoner enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Whenever Aether Poisoner attacks, you may pay {E}{E}. If you do, create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.

cards.flavor: "You never know what day might be your last."
cards.name: Alley Strangler
cards.text: Menace

cards.flavor:
"This is bigger than you. All of you."
—Tezzeret
cards.name: Battle at the Bridge
cards.text:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn. You gain X life.

cards.flavor: Bitter the bite of a demon's steel, and deep the abyss it opens.
cards.name: Cruel Finality
cards.text: Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn. Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

cards.flavor: Living so close to death gives the aetherborn an unusual perspective on risk.
cards.name: Daring Demolition
cards.text: Destroy target creature or Vehicle.

cards.flavor: "I didn't survive that crash just so I could fall to the likes of you."
cards.name: Defiant Salvager
cards.text: Sacrifice an artifact or creature: Put a +1/+1 counter on Defiant Salvager. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

cards.name: Fatal Push
cards.text:
Destroy target creature if it has converted mana cost 2 or less.
Revolt — Destroy that creature if it has converted mana cost 4 or less instead if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn.

cards.flavor:
"Success is found where others fear to look."
—Ara, renegade smuggler
cards.name: Fen Hauler
cards.text:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
Fen Hauler can't be blocked by artifact creatures.

cards.flavor: Its buzzing is easily mistaken for the hum of a thopter's wings.
cards.name: Foundry Hornet
cards.text:
Flying
When Foundry Hornet enters the battlefield, if you control a creature with a +1/+1 counter on it, creatures your opponents control get -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Renegades run the gamut from lofty sages to petty thieves.
cards.name: Fourth Bridge Prowler
cards.text: When Fourth Bridge Prowler enters the battlefield, you may have target creature get -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: A few aetherborn have discovered a way to sustain their own existences at the cost of an insatiable hunger for the life essence of other beings.
cards.name: Gifted Aetherborn
cards.text: Deathtouch, lifelink

cards.name: Glint-Sleeve Siphoner
cards.text:
Menace
Whenever Glint-Sleeve Siphoner enters the battlefield or attacks, you get {E} (an energy counter).
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {E}{E}. If you do, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.

cards.flavor: "I am confident that all our enterprises can benefit from this little revolution."
cards.name: Gonti's Machinations
cards.text:
Whenever you lose life for the first time each turn, you get {E}. (You get an energy counter. Damage causes loss of life.)
Pay {E}{E}, Sacrifice Gonti's Machinations: Each opponent loses 3 life. You gain life equal to the life lost this way.

cards.name: Herald of Anguish
cards.text:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
Flying
At the beginning of your end step, each opponent discards a card.
{1}{B}, Sacrifice an artifact: Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: As the rebellion spread, renegade ingenuity outpaced the Consulate's greatest fears.
cards.name: Ironclad Revolutionary
cards.text: When Ironclad Revolutionary enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice an artifact. If you do, put two +1/+1 counters on Ironclad Revolutionary and each opponent loses 2 life.

cards.name: Midnight Entourage
cards.text:
Other Aetherborn you control get +1/+1.
Whenever Midnight Entourage or another Aetherborn you control dies, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.

cards.flavor: "Death might come tomorrow, but today—today I am alive."
cards.name: Night Market Aeronaut
cards.text:
Flying
Revolt — Night Market Aeronaut enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn.

cards.flavor: Comrades in life. Comrades in death.
cards.name: Perilous Predicament
cards.text: Each opponent sacrifices an artifact creature and a nonartifact creature.

cards.flavor: You can't fight what you can't find.
cards.name: Renegade's Getaway
cards.text: Target permanent gains indestructible until end of turn. Create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token. (Effects that say "destroy" don't destroy a permanent with indestructible, and if it's a creature, it can't be destroyed by damage.)

cards.flavor: When the salvage team brought in the shattered gearhulk, a wave of excitement swept through the renegade foundry.
cards.name: Resourceful Return
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand. If you control an artifact, draw a card.

cards.flavor: There is no shortage of illegal salvage in Ghirapur, nor of those who are willing to profit from it.
cards.name: Secret Salvage
cards.text: Exile target nonland card from your graveyard. Search your library for any number of cards with the same name as that card, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Sly Requisitioner
cards.text:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
Whenever a nontoken artifact you control is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.

cards.flavor: Some aetherborn joined the rebellion for profit, others for the sake of their freedom, still others for revenge.
cards.name: Vengeful Rebel
cards.text: Revolt — When Vengeful Rebel enters the battlefield, if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn, target creature an opponent controls gets -3/-3 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "The time for subtlety is over, darling."
cards.name: Yahenni, Undying Partisan
cards.text:
Haste
Whenever a creature an opponent controls dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Yahenni, Undying Partisan.
Sacrifice another creature: Yahenni gains indestructible until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "The Consulate pushed me to my limit, darling, and this is the result."
cards.name: Yahenni's Expertise
cards.text:
All creatures get -3/-3 until end of turn.
You may cast a card with converted mana cost 3 or less from your hand without paying its mana cost.

cards.name: Aether Chaser
cards.text:
First strike
When Aether Chaser enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Whenever Aether Chaser attacks, you may pay {E}{E}. If you do, create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.

cards.flavor: Chandra was driven by her anger, directed particularly at the man who had taken her father from her.
cards.name: Chandra's Revolution
cards.text: Chandra's Revolution deals 4 damage to target creature. Tap target land. That land doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

cards.flavor:
"I don't think they'll appreciate my . . . adjustments."
—Karavin, renegade saboteur
cards.name: Destructive Tampering
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target artifact.
• Creatures without flying can't block this turn.

cards.flavor: "A well-made wrench is a versatile, indispensable tool."
cards.name: Embraal Gear-Smasher
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice an artifact: Embraal Gear-Smasher deals 2 damage to each opponent.

cards.flavor: When fighting spilled over into Giant's Walk, the aether weapons and swooping airships angered the normally placid creatures.
cards.name: Enraged Giant
cards.text:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
Trample, haste

cards.flavor: The dragons perching in Freejam's towers symbolize the zone's fierce independence.
cards.name: Freejam Regent
cards.text:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
Flying
{1}{R}: Freejam Regent gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "Will you be strong and stand with me?"
cards.name: Frontline Rebel
cards.text: Frontline Rebel attacks each combat if able.

cards.name: Gremlin Infestation
cards.text:
Enchant artifact
At the beginning of your end step, Gremlin Infestation deals 2 damage to enchanted artifact's controller.
When enchanted artifact is put into a graveyard, create a 2/2 red Gremlin creature token.

cards.flavor: In the hold of the Heart of Kiran, Chandra answered Dovin Baan's sabotage with an explosive retort.
cards.name: Hungry Flames
cards.text: Hungry Flames deals 3 damage to target creature and 2 damage to target player.

cards.name: Indomitable Creativity
cards.text: Destroy X target artifacts and/or creatures. For each permanent destroyed this way, its controller reveals cards from the top of his or her library until an artifact or creature card is revealed and exiles that card. Those players put the exiled cards onto the battlefield, then shuffle their libraries.

cards.flavor: Gremlins can change from pest to problem to plague in the span of a moment.
cards.name: Invigorated Rampage
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Target creature gets +4/+0 and gains trample until end of turn.
• Two target creatures each get +2/+0 and gain trample until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Aboard her ship, the Dragon's Smile, Kari follows no one's rules but her own.
cards.name: Kari Zev, Skyship Raider
cards.text:
First strike, menace
Whenever Kari Zev, Skyship Raider attacks, create a legendary 2/1 red Monkey creature token named Ragavan that's tapped and attacking. Exile that token at end of combat.

cards.flavor: "I was made for this!"
cards.name: Kari Zev's Expertise
cards.text:
Gain control of target creature or Vehicle until end of turn. Untap it. It gains haste until end of turn.
You may cast a card with converted mana cost 2 or less from your hand without paying its mana cost.

cards.flavor: Travelers to Lathnu, high on the Devra Cliffs, need not fear the political strife of Ghirapur . . . but they have other dangers to worry about.
cards.name: Lathnu Sailback

cards.flavor: "Catch me if you can."
cards.name: Lightning Runner
cards.text:
Double strike, haste
Whenever Lightning Runner attacks, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters), then you may pay {E}{E}{E}{E}{E}{E}{E}{E}. If you pay, untap all creatures you control, and after this phase, there is an additional combat phase.

cards.flavor: Pia's passion was directed at the big picture—at making real, lasting change.
cards.name: Pia's Revolution
cards.text: Whenever a nontoken artifact is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, return that card to your hand unless target opponent has Pia's Revolution deal 3 damage to him or her.

cards.flavor: "Hit where it hurts, and always hit first."
cards.name: Precise Strike
cards.text: Target creature gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "Let's add just a bit more stopping power."
cards.name: Quicksmith Rebel
cards.text: When Quicksmith Rebel enters the battlefield, target artifact you control gains "{T}: This artifact deals 2 damage to target creature or player" for as long as you control Quicksmith Rebel.

cards.flavor:
"I've made some fine acquisitions of late, so I'm planning to make commensurate improvements to my security systems. I have a consultant coming tomorrow."
—Kurna Majan, Luminary League
cards.name: Ravenous Intruder
cards.text: Sacrifice an artifact: Ravenous Intruder gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Illegal street races turned out to be perfect practice for avoiding Consulate patrols.
cards.name: Reckless Racer
cards.text:
First strike
Whenever Reckless Racer becomes tapped, you may discard a card. If you do, draw a card.

cards.flavor:
"Being an inventor means knowing how to use the tools at hand to make something great—or to bring it down."
—Pia Nalaar
cards.name: Release the Gremlins
cards.text: Destroy X target artifacts. Create X 2/2 red Gremlin creature tokens.

cards.name: Scrapper Champion
cards.text:
Double strike (This creature deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)
When Scrapper Champion enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Whenever Scrapper Champion attacks, you may pay {E}{E}. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.flavor: The tools of invention became the weapons of revolution.
cards.name: Shock
cards.text: Shock deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: Perfect for getting through to the consuls.
cards.name: Siege Modification
cards.text:
Enchant creature or Vehicle
As long as enchanted permanent is a Vehicle, it's a creature in addition to its other types.
Enchanted creature gets +3/+0 and has first strike.

cards.flavor: The residents of Embraal were never known for finesse, just for getting things done.
cards.name: Sweatworks Brawler
cards.text:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
Menace

cards.flavor: Gremlins are loyal to nothing but their next meal.
cards.name: Wrangle
cards.text: Gain control of target creature with power 4 or less until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Aether Herder
cards.text:
When Aether Herder enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Whenever Aether Herder attacks, you may pay {E}{E}. If you do, create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.

cards.name: Aetherstream Leopard
cards.text:
Trample
When Aetherstream Leopard enters the battlefield, you get {E} (an energy counter).
Whenever Aetherstream Leopard attacks, you may pay {E}. If you do, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Its frill inspired the design of efficient aether collectors.
cards.name: Aetherwind Basker
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever Aetherwind Basker enters the battlefield or attacks, you get {E} (an energy counter) for each creature you control.
Pay {E}: Aetherwind Basker gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Aid from the Cowl
cards.text: Revolt — At the beginning of your end step, if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a permanent card, you may put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, you may put it on the bottom of your library.

cards.flavor: "The wild tangle of the Cowl provides sanctuary to life that watched the first buildings rise."
cards.name: Druid of the Cowl
cards.text: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: Subtlety is not a necessary part of sabotage.
cards.name: Greenbelt Rampager
cards.text: When Greenbelt Rampager enters the battlefield, pay {E}{E} (two energy counters). If you can't, return Greenbelt Rampager to its owner's hand and you get {E}.

cards.flavor: "I will not rest until every vestige of the Consulate—every banner, flag, and standard—has fallen."
cards.name: Greenwheel Liberator
cards.text: Revolt — Greenwheel Liberator enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn.

cards.flavor:
"Wherever the strong would harm the weak, I will be there."
—Ajani Goldmane
cards.name: Heroic Intervention
cards.text: Permanents you control gain hexproof and indestructible until end of turn.

cards.flavor: In the cellars beneath Narnam House, a strange and deadly garden grows.
cards.name: Hidden Herbalists
cards.text: Revolt — When Hidden Herbalists enters the battlefield, if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn, add {G}{G} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor:
"If nothing else, the Inventors' Fair taught us that we're only beginning to discover aether's true potential."
—Kershan Danil, Highspire artisan
cards.name: Highspire Infusion
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn. You get {E}{E} (two energy counters).

cards.flavor: "It was made, yes, but that does not mean it cannot grow."
cards.name: Lifecraft Awakening
cards.text: Put X +1/+1 counters on target artifact you control. If it isn't a creature or Vehicle, it becomes a 0/0 Construct artifact creature.

cards.flavor:
"I do not ask you to be tame. I only ask you to be true."
—Rishkar, Peema renegade
cards.name: Lifecraft Cavalry
cards.text:
Trample
Revolt — Lifecraft Cavalry enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn.

cards.flavor: The best engineers recognize when a problem has already been solved.
cards.name: Lifecrafter's Gift
cards.text: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature, then put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Maulfist Revolutionary
cards.text:
Trample
When Maulfist Revolutionary enters the battlefield or dies, for each kind of counter on target permanent or player, give that permanent or player another counter of that kind.

cards.flavor:
"Regards from Peema."
—Rishkar
cards.name: Monstrous Onslaught
cards.text: Monstrous Onslaught deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures, where X is the greatest power among creatures you control as you cast Monstrous Onslaught.

cards.flavor: "I do not need to pierce your heart to still its beating."
cards.name: Narnam Renegade
cards.text:
Deathtouch
Revolt — Narnam Renegade enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn.

cards.flavor:
"It is folly to believe your precious inventions will endure. All things return to the soil."
—Nirav, Tirahar elder
cards.name: Natural Obsolescence
cards.text: Put target artifact on the bottom of its owner's library.

cards.flavor: "The Great Conduit connects us all."
cards.name: Peema Aether-Seer
cards.text:
When Peema Aether-Seer enters the battlefield, you get an amount of {E} (energy counters) equal to the greatest power among creatures you control.
Pay {E}{E}{E}: Target creature blocks this turn if able.

cards.flavor: It is the nature of the strong to survive.
cards.name: Prey Upon
cards.text: Target creature you control fights target creature you don't control. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)

cards.flavor:
"Each creature holds a solution to a problem, a lesson to be learned."
—Oviya Pashiri, sage lifecrafter
cards.name: Ridgescale Tusker
cards.text: When Ridgescale Tusker enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on each other creature you control.

cards.flavor: "Aether is the soul of Kaladesh, and all souls should be free."
cards.name: Rishkar, Peema Renegade
cards.text:
When Rishkar, Peema Renegade enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to two target creatures.
Each creature you control with a counter on it has "{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool."

cards.flavor: "Control the Great Conduit? You might as well try to divert a river with your hands."
cards.name: Rishkar's Expertise
cards.text:
Draw cards equal to the greatest power among creatures you control.
You may cast a card with converted mana cost 5 or less from your hand without paying its mana cost.

cards.flavor: "It was right here a second ago . . ."
cards.name: Scrounging Bandar
cards.text:
Scrounging Bandar enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may move any number of +1/+1 counters from Scrounging Bandar onto another target creature.

cards.flavor: Elvish weavers use spidersilk to make everything from tapestries to rappelling ropes.
cards.name: Silkweaver Elite
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Revolt — When Silkweaver Elite enters the battlefield, if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn, draw a card.

cards.flavor:
"If the Consulate has abandoned restraint, so too shall the wilds."
—Surash, keeper of the Cowl
cards.name: Unbridled Growth
cards.text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."
Sacrifice Unbridled Growth: Draw a card.

cards.name: Ajani Unyielding
cards.text:
+2: Reveal the top three cards of your library. Put all nonland permanent cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
−2: Exile target creature. Its controller gains life equal to its power.
−9: Put five +1/+1 counters on each creature you control and five loyalty counters on each other planeswalker you control.

cards.name: Dark Intimations
cards.text:
Each opponent sacrifices a creature or planeswalker, then discards a card. You return a creature or planeswalker card from your graveyard to your hand, then draw a card.
When you cast a Bolas planeswalker spell, exile Dark Intimations from your graveyard. That planeswalker enters the battlefield with an additional loyalty counter on it.

cards.name: Hidden Stockpile
cards.text:
Revolt — At the beginning of your end step, if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn, create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.
{1}, Sacrifice a creature: Scry 1.

cards.name: Maverick Thopterist
cards.text:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
When Maverick Thopterist enters the battlefield, create two 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature tokens with flying.

cards.flavor: "Until all have found their place, I will keep watch."
cards.name: Oath of Ajani
cards.text:
When Oath of Ajani enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control.
Planeswalker spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.

cards.flavor: The vibrant forest of Peema is awash with aether. Its animals are stronger, faster, and more aggressive than their counterparts elsewhere.
cards.name: Outland Boar
cards.text: Outland Boar can't be blocked by creatures with power 2 or less.

cards.flavor: "This fight belongs to us all."
cards.name: Renegade Rallier
cards.text: Revolt — When Renegade Rallier enters the battlefield, if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn, return target permanent card with converted mana cost 2 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.flavor: Many veterans of the Ovalchase racetrack turned their talents to the renegade cause.
cards.name: Renegade Wheelsmith
cards.text: Whenever Renegade Wheelsmith becomes tapped, target creature can't block this turn.

cards.flavor: "It's natural, it's all around us, and it's there for the taking. Just try and tell me what I'm doing is wrong."
cards.name: Rogue Refiner
cards.text: When Rogue Refiner enters the battlefield, draw a card and you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).

cards.flavor: "After I examine your cargo and check your papers, you can be on your way."
cards.name: Spire Patrol
cards.text:
Flying
When Spire Patrol enters the battlefield, tap target creature an opponent controls. That creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

cards.name: Tezzeret the Schemer
cards.text:
+1: Create a colorless artifact token named Etherium Cell with "{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."
−2: Target creature gets +X/-X until end of turn, where X is the number of artifacts you control.
−7: You get an emblem with "At the beginning of combat on your turn, target artifact you control becomes an artifact creature with base power and toughness 5/5."

cards.name: Tezzeret's Touch
cards.text:
Enchant artifact
Enchanted artifact is a creature with base power and toughness 5/5 in addition to its other types.
When enchanted artifact is put into a graveyard, return that card to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: "Let's err on the side of glorious mayhem."
cards.name: Weldfast Engineer
cards.text: At the beginning of combat on your turn, target artifact creature you control gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Winding Constrictor
cards.text:
If one or more counters would be placed on an artifact or creature you control, that many plus one of each of those kinds of counters are placed on that permanent instead.
If you would get one or more counters, you get that many plus one of each of those kinds of counters instead.

cards.flavor: The streets of Ghirapur have become dangerous. It's good to have a dependable companion.
cards.name: Aegis Automaton
cards.text: {4}{W}: Return another target creature you control to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Aethersphere Harvester
cards.text:
Flying
When Aethersphere Harvester enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Pay {E}: Aethersphere Harvester gains lifelink until end of turn.
Crew 1 (Tap any number of creatures you control with total power 1 or more: This Vehicle becomes an artifact creature until end of turn.)

cards.flavor: When you have taught an automaton how to build others of its kind, it is a small step to make it build itself.
cards.name: Augmenting Automaton
cards.text: {1}{B}: Augmenting Automaton gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"The Consulate sought to crush us. Let's give them a taste of their own medicine."
—Venkat Dasai, renegade commander
cards.name: Barricade Breaker
cards.text:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
Barricade Breaker attacks each combat if able.

cards.flavor: Duplication is neither thievery nor flattery. It is efficiency.
cards.name: Cogwork Assembler
cards.text: {7}: Create a token that's a copy of target artifact. That token gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.flavor:
"It's like they planted another Bastion right in the middle of the harbor."
—Bes Tavani, Bomat merchant
cards.name: Consulate Dreadnought
cards.text: Crew 6 (Tap any number of creatures you control with total power 6 or more: This Vehicle becomes an artifact creature until end of turn.)

cards.flavor:
"Our watchtowers are well positioned. Why don't we arm them?"
—Enforcer-Chief Ranaj
cards.name: Consulate Turret
cards.text:
{T}: You get {E} (an energy counter).
{T}, Pay {E}{E}{E}: Consulate Turret deals 2 damage to target player.

cards.flavor:
"All buildings are subject to search. Resistance will be punished."
—Enforcer-Chief Ranaj
cards.name: Crackdown Construct
cards.text: Whenever you activate an ability of an artifact or creature that isn't a mana ability, Crackdown Construct gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Daredevil Dragster
cards.text:
At end of combat, if Daredevil Dragster attacked or blocked this combat, put a velocity counter on it. Then if it has two or more velocity counters on it, sacrifice it and draw two cards.
Crew 2 (Tap any number of creatures you control with total power 2 or more: This Vehicle becomes an artifact creature until end of turn.)

cards.flavor:
"The most harmonious designs are based on relationships found in nature."
—Venand Kapur, the Gearherder
cards.name: Filigree Crawler
cards.text: When Filigree Crawler dies, create a 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature token with flying.

cards.flavor:
"They never tire, they never complain, and they never ask questions. Build more."
—Ivash, Consulate inventor
cards.name: Foundry Assembler
cards.text: Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)

cards.flavor: Despite the magic that sustains Gonti's life, the crime lord is often described as heartless.
cards.name: Gonti's Aether Heart
cards.text:
Whenever Gonti's Aether Heart or another artifact enters the battlefield under your control, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Pay {E}{E}{E}{E}{E}{E}{E}{E}, Exile Gonti's Aether Heart: Take an extra turn after this one.

cards.name: Heart of Kiran
cards.text:
Flying, vigilance
Crew 3 (Tap any number of creatures you control with total power 3 or more: This Vehicle becomes an artifact creature until end of turn.)
You may remove a loyalty counter from a planeswalker you control rather than pay Heart of Kiran's crew cost.

cards.flavor: The renegades mounted an aether disruptor aboard a lightweight thopter to destroy Tezzeret's Planar Bridge.
cards.name: Hope of Ghirapur
cards.text:
Flying
Sacrifice Hope of Ghirapur: Until your next turn, target player who was dealt combat damage by Hope of Ghirapur this turn can't cast noncreature spells.

cards.flavor: A dream of fire lies coiled inside, waiting for its glorious awakening.
cards.name: Implement of Combustion
cards.text:
{R}, Sacrifice Implement of Combustion: It deals 1 damage to target player.
When Implement of Combustion is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, draw a card.

cards.flavor: A tool to see the unseen.
cards.name: Implement of Examination
cards.text:
{U}, Sacrifice Implement of Examination: Draw a card.
When Implement of Examination is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, draw a card.

cards.name: Implement of Ferocity
cards.text:
{G}, Sacrifice Implement of Ferocity: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
When Implement of Ferocity is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, draw a card.

cards.flavor: A mystery in metal.
cards.name: Implement of Improvement
cards.text:
{W}, Sacrifice Implement of Improvement: You gain 2 life.
When Implement of Improvement is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, draw a card.

cards.name: Implement of Malice
cards.text:
{B}, Sacrifice Implement of Malice: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
When Implement of Malice is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, draw a card.

cards.flavor: Ghirapur's most celebrated inventors have been immortalized in clockwork.
cards.name: Inspiring Statuary
cards.text: Nonartifact spells you cast have improvise. (Your artifacts can help cast those spells. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)

cards.flavor: "We've been through a lot together."
cards.name: Irontread Crusher
cards.text: Crew 3 (Tap any number of creatures you control with total power 3 or more: This Vehicle becomes an artifact creature until end of turn.)

cards.flavor:
"Inspiration is found by looking outward."
—Oviya Pashiri, sage lifecrafter
cards.name: Lifecrafter's Bestiary
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, scry 1.
Whenever you cast a creature spell, you may pay {G}. If you do, draw a card.

cards.flavor:
"If you can build it, we can move it."
—Bes Tavani, Bomat merchant
cards.name: Merchant's Dockhand
cards.text: {3}{U}, {T}, Tap X untapped artifacts you control: Look at the top X cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.name: Metallic Mimic
cards.text:
As Metallic Mimic enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
Metallic Mimic is the chosen type in addition to its other types.
Each other creature you control of the chosen type enters the battlefield with an additional +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Mobile Garrison
cards.text:
Whenever Mobile Garrison attacks, untap another target artifact or creature you control.
Crew 2 (Tap any number of creatures you control with total power 2 or more: This Vehicle becomes an artifact creature until end of turn.)

cards.flavor:
"One head watches for Consulate enforcers. The other watches for renegade thieves."
—Crime Lord Gonti
cards.name: Night Market Guard
cards.text: Night Market Guard can block an additional creature each combat.

cards.flavor:
"You want to know what we are fighting for? Look at the wonder in that child's eyes."
—Pia Nalaar
cards.name: Ornithopter
cards.text: Flying

cards.flavor: The Consulate had access to thousands of innovative devices displayed at the Inventors' Fair. A few small changes transformed some of them from marvels of ingenuity to instruments of oppression.
cards.name: Pacification Array
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Tap target artifact or creature.

cards.flavor:
"One look at this glorious item convinced me that Kaladesh deserved my full attention. Sure enough, my time here has yielded exquisite fruit."
—Tezzeret
cards.name: Paradox Engine
cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell, untap all nonland permanents you control.

cards.flavor:
"Peace? Its sole purpose is fear."
—Saheeli Rai
cards.name: Peacewalker Colossus
cards.text:
{1}{W}: Another target Vehicle you control becomes an artifact creature until end of turn.
Crew 4 (Tap any number of creatures you control with total power 4 or more: This Vehicle becomes an artifact creature until end of turn.)

cards.flavor:
"It is finished. Now the real work can begin."
—Tezzeret
cards.name: Planar Bridge
cards.text: {8}, {T}: Search your library for a permanent card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: The Scrappers, an underground group with a passion for automaton brawls, had renegade leanings even before the Consulate's crackdown. It didn't take long for them to lend their best brawlers to the conflict.
cards.name: Prizefighter Construct

cards.flavor: "We have safe houses in every zone, but you'll never find one without this."
cards.name: Renegade Map
cards.text:
Renegade Map enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}, Sacrifice Renegade Map: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: Renegade supply lines are, by necessity, mobile and difficult to disrupt.
cards.name: Reservoir Walker
cards.text: When Reservoir Walker enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life and get {E}{E}{E} (three energy counters).

cards.name: Scrap Trawler
cards.text: Whenever Scrap Trawler or another artifact you control is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return to your hand target artifact card in your graveyard with lesser converted mana cost.

cards.flavor: The Consulate prizes innovation when it is dependable and replicable.
cards.name: Servo Schematic
cards.text: When Servo Schematic enters the battlefield or is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.

cards.name: Treasure Keeper
cards.text: When Treasure Keeper dies, reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a nonland card with converted mana cost 3 or less. You may cast that card without paying its mana cost. Put all revealed cards not cast this way on the bottom of your library in a random order.

cards.flavor:
"A few drops of this, and the trickiest problems simply melt away."
—Thamaz, Weldfast inventor
cards.name: Universal Solvent
cards.text: {7}, {T}, Sacrifice Universal Solvent: Destroy target permanent.

cards.flavor: Rules and rails are made to be broken.
cards.name: Untethered Express
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever Untethered Express attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
Crew 1 (Tap any number of creatures you control with total power 1 or more: This Vehicle becomes an artifact creature until end of turn.)

cards.flavor:
"A perfect fusion of nature and artifice."
—Irsi, Kujar gardener
cards.name: Verdant Automaton
cards.text: {3}{G}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Verdant Automaton.

cards.name: Walking Ballista
cards.text:
Walking Ballista enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
{4}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Walking Ballista.
Remove a +1/+1 counter from Walking Ballista: It deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor:
"Before we can destroy our enemies, we must find them. We must peer into every wretched hovel and every teeming market."
—Baral, Chief of Compliance
cards.name: Watchful Automaton
cards.text: {2}{U}: Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

cards.flavor: Most of the constructs the renegades used against the Consulate weren't originally intended for combat. But some didn't require much modification.
cards.name: Welder Automaton
cards.text: {3}{R}: Welder Automaton deals 1 damage to each opponent.

cards.flavor: A beacon of prosperity to some, a shadow of oppression to others.
cards.name: Spire of Industry
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{T}, Pay 1 life: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. Activate this ability only if you control an artifact.

cards.name: Ajani, Valiant Protector
cards.text:
+2: Put two +1/+1 counters on up to one target creature.
+1: Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a creature card. Put that card into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.
−11: Put X +1/+1 counters on target creature, where X is your life total. That creature gains trample until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"This is about more than aether or inventions. Tezzeret's schemes must be stopped!"
—Ajani Goldmane
cards.name: Inspiring Roar
cards.text: Put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control.

cards.flavor: "I will go where the lion-man leads."
cards.name: Ajani's Comrade
cards.text:
Trample
At the beginning of combat on your turn, if you control an Ajani planeswalker, put a +1/+1 counter on Ajani's Comrade.

cards.name: Ajani's Aid
cards.text:
When Ajani's Aid enters the battlefield, you may search your library and/or graveyard for a card named Ajani, Valiant Protector, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you search your library this way, shuffle it.
Sacrifice Ajani's Aid: Prevent all combat damage a creature of your choice would deal this turn.

cards.flavor: Beyond the chaos of Ghirapur lies a vibrant world where aether flows through nature.
cards.name: Tranquil Expanse
cards.text:
Tranquil Expanse enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Tezzeret, Master of Metal
cards.text:
+1: Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal an artifact card. Put that card into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.
−3: Target opponent loses life equal to the number of artifacts you control.
−8: Gain control of all artifacts and creatures target opponent controls.

cards.flavor:
"You can't hope to comprehend the plans that are in motion."
—Tezzeret
cards.name: Tezzeret's Betrayal
cards.text: Destroy target creature. You may search your library and/or graveyard for a card named Tezzeret, Master of Metal, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you search your library this way, shuffle it.

cards.flavor: Its elaborate designs reveal secrets of aether's flow.
cards.name: Pendulum of Patterns
cards.text:
When Pendulum of Patterns enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.
{5}, {T}, Sacrifice Pendulum of Patterns: Draw a card.

cards.flavor: Tezzeret's command of living metal has nothing to do with intricate gearcraft or aether supplies.
cards.name: Tezzeret's Simulacrum
cards.text: {T}: Target opponent loses 1 life. If you control a Tezzeret planeswalker, that player loses 3 life instead.

cards.flavor: Aether currents in the sky mirror water currents below, including the deadly rapids.
cards.name: Submerged Boneyard
cards.text:
Submerged Boneyard enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool.
